mvt_properties.Title: Brightness Temperature (Channel I-4)
mvt_properties.Description: Channel I-4 brightness temperature of the fire pixel, measured in Kelvin.

mvt_properties.Title: Brightness Temperature (Channel I-5)
mvt_properties.Description: Channel I-5 brightness temperature of the fire pixel, measured in Kelvin.

mvt_properties.Title: Fire Radiative Power
mvt_properties.Description: The Fire Radiative Power (FRP) is a measure of the rate of radiant heat output from a fire. It has been demonstrated in small-scale experimental fires that the FRP of a fire is related to the rate at which fuel is being consumed (Wooster et al., 2005) and smoke emissions released (Freeborn et al., 2008).

mvt_properties.Title: Detection Confidence
mvt_properties.Description: This value is based on a collection of intermediate algorithm quantities used in the detection process. It is intended to help users gauge the quality of individual hotspot/fire pixels. Confidence values are set to low, nominal and high.  Low confidence daytime fire pixels are typically associated with areas of sun glint and lower relative temperature anomaly (<15K) in the mid-infrared channel I4. Nominal confidence pixels are those free of potential sun glint contamination during the day and marked by strong (>15K) temperature anomaly in either day or nighttime data. High confidence fire pixels are associated with day or nighttime saturated pixels.

mvt_properties.Title: Day/Night Flag
mvt_properties.Description: Indicates whether the fire point was observed during the ‘day’ or ‘night’.

mvt_properties.Title: Along-Scan Pixel Size
mvt_properties.Description: The algorithm produces 375m pixels at nadir, but pixels get bigger toward the edge of scan. This value reflects the actual along-scan pixel size.

mvt_properties.Title: Along-Track Pixel Size
mvt_properties.Description: The algorithm produces 375m pixels at nadir, but pixels get bigger toward the edge of scan. This value reflects the actual along-track pixel size.

mvt_properties.Title: Acquisition Date
mvt_properties.Description: The date of acquisition for this fire point. (YYYY-MM-DD)

mvt_properties.Title: Acquisition Time
mvt_properties.Description: The time of acquisition for this fire point, in UTC. (HHMM)

mvt_properties.Title: Inferred Hot Spot Type
mvt_properties.Description: The inferred type of the detected hot spot.

ValueMap.3: Offshore detection (Includes all detections over water)

mvt_properties.Title: Satellite
mvt_properties.Description: Satellite from which the fire is observed.

mvt_properties.Title: Collection and Source
mvt_properties.Description: The collection (e.g. VIIRS Collection 1) and source of data processing: Near Real-Time (NRT suffix added to collection) or Standard Processing (collection only).

mvt_properties.Title: Unique Identifier
mvt_properties.Description: Unique identifier of the data point.
